Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2017 09:51AM Sandzat wrote: Hi dear all, I'm a 40 year old who had mastectomy with sentinel node biopsy done on Feb 6th for a 1.7 cms tumour in my left breast and a widespread area across the centre throwing up a type 3 curve in the MRI scan. I felt the lump in a self exam, had many diagnostic tests done and finally wanted to have a lumpectomy, but the Doctor wouldn't hear of it... Anyways, the surgery is over now. And I'm home now with a drain attached for the next few days/weeks. And many painkillers. Today is Day 5. My histopathology report should be ready by Monday. I'm hoping that that there is not much axilliary lymph node metastases. I will also know my stage then. And the treatment plan.
Posts.Title: February 2017 Surgery Hahlyn Jackiebro

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2017 09:59AM Sandzat wrote: My histopathology report came out node negative. I opted not to do any recon right away and to heal first. I'm going with a prosthesis now. My oncoplastic surgeon recommended chemotherapy followed by tamoxifen. However, my medical oncologist looking at my Ki-67 and hormone receptor status suggested that I take tamoxifen religiously but chemo for me offered minimal benefits. So I chose to forego it. Time will only tell if I made a good decision... Meanwhile, I'm recovering from the surgery. My range of motion is back by about 90%. Though I always feel like something is in there/moving under the arm when I lift it up. Also the surgical site is still numb and causes discomfort I can't stand to touch it. How are you all recovering? It gives me great comfort to know how everyone here comes out to tell their story, and offer guidance and support wherever needed. Good luck and best wishes to all.
